channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Apple Watch can monitor the frailty of cardiovascular patients at home
item.description: A Stanford study has determined that the Apple Watch can monitor the frailty of cardiovascular disease patients when they're at home — it's about as good as a clinic.

item.title: This is the most detailed picture of a black hole to date
item.description: Scientists have captured an image of the M87 galaxy's black hole showing how it looks in polarized light, revealing the shape of key magnetic fields.

item.title: Peacock is removing racist scenes from classic WWE matches
item.description: NBCUniversal's Peacock is removing racist scenes from classic WWE matches as it comes to terms with a troublesome streaming catalog.

item.title: Scotland’s renewable energy matched 97 percent of demand in 2020
item.description: 97.4 percent of Scotland's gross electric consumption came from clean energy sources in 2020.

item.title: 'Hamster ball' robot could explore Moon caves
item.description: The ESA is backing a 'hamster ball' robot, DAEDALUS, that would explore Moon caves for signs of water ice and even potential settler sites.

item.title: Vizio's rotating Dolby Atmos soundbar is $200 off at Amazon
item.description: Vizio's rotating Elevate soundbar has received a $200 discount at Amazon, making it a better deal if you want wireless Dolby Atmos in a compact size.

item.title: Facebook freezes Venezuela president's page over false COVID-19 claims
item.description: Facebook has frozen the page of Venezuela president Maduro for a month for posting COVID-19 misinformation.

item.title: Hitting the Books: Extraterrestrial careers and the power of human cultural bias
item.description: Mathematics may be considered a universal constant — and surefire way to communicate with extraterrestrials — but there's no guarantee that the next spacefaring civilization we come in contact with will understand the universe the way we do.

item.title: Protect your home with a private security camera powered by blockchain technology
item.description: Ucam is a completely private security camera you can operate from your phone. With two-way audio, motion detection and 360-degree views, you can monitor your home from anywhere.

item.title: The Morning After: Razer’s high-tech face mask concept is going into production
item.description: This week's biggest tech stories, including Razer’s RGB light-infused face mask. It has wannabe cyber ninjas very excited, and the company is going to produce it.

item.title: Netflix is launching 40 anime movies and shows in 2021
item.description: Netflix has announced at Tokyo's AnimeJapan 2021 Expo that it's launching around 40 anime shows and movies within the year, which is double the number of titles it released in 2020.

item.title: ‘Rocket League’ season three will feature F1 and NASCAR vehicles
item.description: Psyonix retooled an arena to add a track and the pomp of a championship Sunday.

item.title: Ford and HP team up to make F-250 parts from 3D printer waste
item.description: With help from HP, Ford found a way to reuse spent 3D printed powders and parts to create injection molded vehicle parts.

item.title: Apple releases iOS 14.4.2 and watchOS 7.3.3 to close an active vulnerability
item.description: Apple recommends all users download iOS 14.4.2 and watchOS 7.3.3 as soon as possible.

item.title: Survival game 'Rust' will hit PS4 and Xbox One on May 21st
item.description: They'll have a separate update roadmap from the PC version.

item.title: 'Nobody Saves the World' is a shapeshifting RPG from DrinkBox Studios
item.description: DrinkBox is pitching the game as an action RPG that includes everything people love about the genre, with none of the cruft.

item.title: Jeep is installing EV chargers at off-road trailheads throughout the US
item.description: The first three will arrive in Utah and California this spring.

item.title: VW's electric ID.Buzz Microbus will hit the US in 2023
item.description: Europe gets the EV next year, but VW probably won't release the fully autonomous version in the US.

item.title: HBO Max gets more accessible with audio-described content rollout
item.description: The changes coming this week include "nearly 1,500 hours of audio described content on web and mobile platforms." Some of these titles include His Dark Materials, Dunkirk, Euphoria and Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice.

item.title: No one agrees on how to fix Big Tech
item.description: Section 230 reform should be a delicate process, but everyone involved is wielding a hammer.

item.title: The internet has become a tool for authoritarian repression
item.description: While the internet revolution may have empowered activists, it has also handed new tools to despots for stamping out dissent through digital surveillance, disinformation and internet access to their people.

item.title: This week's best deals: 20 percent off Samsung's T7 Touch SSD and more
item.description: Here's a list of the best tech deals we found this week, including 20 percent off the Samsung T7 Touch SSD and 43 percent off the Amazon Fire HD 10 tablet.

item.title: This center channel speaker by Pioneer is on sale for just $80 right now
item.description: The Pioneer PSP-C22 Andrew Jones Designed Center Channel Speaker provides an excellent upgrade over your TV’s built-in drivers, and it’s currently 46 percent off.

item.title: 'Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 and 2' arrives on PS5 and Xbox Series X
item.description: 'Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 and 2' is now available on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, including 4K and 120FPS options, although it may cost you to upgrade.

item.title: 'S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2' devs are spending a lot of time on teeth
item.description: The 'S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2' developers made a teeth customization tool to play dentist with the horror game's characters.
